newsitem.title: FRANCE: French leisure stocks up on bid rumours.
newsitem.headline: French leisure stocks up on bid rumours.

text.p: Shares in Club Mediterranee rocketed more than five percent in a weak Paris stockmarket on Wednesday on market rumours that hotel group Accor may launch a takeover bid, brokers said.
Officials at Club Mediterranee had no immediate comment, and Accor officials were not available to comment.
Club Med shares were up 5.02 percent at 324.20 francs at 0940 GMT. Accor shares were up 1.05 percent at 675.
Brokers said there was another rumour going through the market that Britain's Granada might be interested in Accor. They said it was fueled by Granada's aim to sell its Exclusive luxury chain.
Granada said it hoped to complete the sale of the 17 luxury hotels by early 1997 on Monday.
A spokesman at Club Med told Reuters, "We have no comment on the matter."
"The (Accor-Club Med) rumour is strong, but like all rumours, it could be share manipulation," a trader said. "It could have something to do with year-end window-dressing."
Another trader said, "we've heard the rumour like everyone. But we don't know."
Accor holds 2.36 percent of Club Med's capital.
Most analysts said a buyout made little sense industrially and would run contrary to Accor's longstanding objective to reduce its debt.
They said Club Med may be a potential target but said foreign groups would be more likely to be interested.
